Deficiency Narrative: Two children's records reviewed found no dental exam have been completed since admission, more than 90 days ago.
Correction Narrative: Effective immediately: Clients dental records will be required at admission. If a client has not had a dental examination within 6 months of admission an appointment will be scheduled within 30 days of admission to occur within 90 days. The results of the dental examination will be documented in the clients record.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the staff records reviewed found staff did not receive trauma informed care training and normalcy training for 2024.
Correction Narrative:
Effective immediately: The Training Coordinator will email all staff **30 days before** all annual training (Trauma informed care, Normalcy etc.) deadlines, including: -Dates, times, and format (in-person/online). **7-Day Follow-Up**. A second email reminder will be sent **7 days prior** to the due date. B. Tracking & Compliance: The training Coordinator will maintain a **Master Log** of all staff training completions. Physical copies of certificates will be filed with employee records. **Non-Compliance Escalation** - If a staff member fails to complete training by the deadline: - The Training Coordinator will notify the **supervisor and Administrator** within **24 hors**. -The staff member will be placed on notice of correction until training is completed. 
compliant staff. **Final Notice (1 Day Before Deadline). **Direct supervisor/scheduling coordinator notified if still incomplete. 

** Consequences for Non-Compliance. ** -If training is not completed by the deadline: -Staff will be temporarily removed from the schedule until training is done.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the staff records reviewed missing annual suicidal prevention training for 2024.
Correction Narrative:
Effective immediately: Mandatory for all caregivers and employees Annual Suicide Training: The Training Coordinator will maintain a centralized data log of all staff training deadlines. **Alerts will be set 30 days before each employees annual due date**. ** Email notification** **30 Day Warning**. Staff receive an email with: -Link to the required training (on-line). -Deadline for completion. ** 7-Day Follow-up**. Reminder email sent to non-compliant staff. **Final Notice (1 Day Before Deadline). **Direct supervisor/scheduling coordinator notified if still incomplete. 

** Consequences for Non-Compliance. ** -If training is not completed by the deadline: -Staff will be temporarily removed from the schedule until training is done.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the staff records reviewed found that staff member did not receive 50 hours of annual training for 2024 as required.
Correction Narrative: Effective Immediately: Annual Training Tracking System. Training Log. The Training Coordinator will create a **master spreadsheet/database tracking system. -Each staff members completed hours. -Deadline for mandatory courses (e.g., EBI every 6 months). **Monthly audits** to flag staff falling behind. **Structured training Schedule** Mandatory Trainings First. ** Quarterly Breakdown: Staff complete~12.5 hours/quarter to avoid year-end gaps. ** Priority Order** 1. Critical Annual Courses**(suicide prevention, abuse and neglect reporting, trauma-informed care). 2.**Bi-Annual EBI refresher**(tracked separately) 3. **CPR/First Aid** (If expired) 4** Elective/Professional Development** (to fill remaining hours).

Deficiency Narrative: On multiple kid files, signatures/initals were missing.
Correction Narrative: Op submitted corrective action plan: Staff administering medication must sign full name at bottom of med sheet before administering the first med. After each administration, staff must initial next to time of administration to confirm the meds are given.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple kids med logs were missing administration times.
Correction Narrative:
Op submitted corrective action plan: Nursing will have one-hour slots twice a week to review and audit the med admin book. Nursing will have a sign off sheet stating that a nurse has reviewed the med books and probs found for each client. Nursing will audit 10 % of clients weekly. Any missing documentation found will be reported immediately to administration. Staff administering meds will be required to double check that the admin time is recorded after every med pass. This will be done by reviewing the med logs immediately after completing pass to ensure no entry is missing time of admin. 
Deficiency was related to documentation. No inspection is required.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that 4 out of 5 children have seen or witnessed a staff member sleeping during shifts of providing care.
Correction Narrative: It was found that there are still allegations of staff sleeping.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation has not submitted the quarterly EBI data reports for 2023 4th Quarter and 2024 1st Quarter.
Correction Narrative: EBI Quarterly Report reviewed in CLASS to have been submitted. Operation reported 1 personal restraint.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's medication was not administered for 3 days due to it being misplaced by operation staff.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation stating a new protocol was implemented effective 10/23/23 requiring two staffs signatures for medication release.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of four children records reviewed suicide attempts were not reported to Licensing within the required time frame.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted a correction action plan indicating Child Care Administrator will meet with all MHT's regarding notifying and reporting suicide attempts and serious incidents a abuse and neglect hotline. Employee training log was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of four child's records reviewed were missing the admission assessment.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted a correction action plan indicating effective immediately the Director of Clinical Services will instruct Admissions Team Lead and Admission Coordinators to ensure all pre-admission assessments are completed and charted when client is admitted.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, it was discovered the operation failed to remove 19 inactive employees from the people's list within required 7 days' timeframe.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted a correction plan indicating all inactive persons who no longer are associated with TCSI will be removed from system within 7 days. An up-to-date employee roster to include volunteers and contractors was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of four children's records reviewed were missing immunization record.
Two out of four children's records reviewed were missing proof of two weeks advance notification of service plan meeting.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted a correction action plan indicating child's parent/guardian will get two weeks advance notice of the initial service plan meeting taking place. The meeting scheduler will email parent of meeting taking place, print the email, and place in chart.

Deficiency Narrative: One of four children's records reviewed were missing child's initial service plan.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted an approved correction action plan indicating the Director of Clinical Services will instruct all clinicians regarding initial service planning and completion requirements within 45 days of admission.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of four children's record reviewed were missing preliminary service.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted a correction action plan indicating effective immediately, Director of Clinical Services will instruct all clinicians to complete preliminary service plan that addresses immediate needs of a child, supervision requirements, enrolling in school, or obtaining needed medical care or clothing within 72 hours.

Deficiency Narrative: Four out of four children's records reviewed were missing protection from unnecessary search information within the child's rights policy.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted a correction action plan indicating effective immediately the client's bill of rights will be updated.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff unnecessarily grabbed, pulled, and pushed a child as a means to get the child to comply.
Correction Narrative: Staff was restrained on EBI training 10/4/22. Additional training was provided for all the staff. Three children who were interviewed stated there has been no form of physical discipline at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection EBI reports were reviewed. Four of the four EBI reports reviewed were missing post discussions that included what a child can do to avoid EBI in the future and how a caregiver can assist. One child interviewed stated that they did not have a post discussion on ways that EBI can be avoided in the future.
Correction Narrative: EBI reports were modified to include post discussion with the children. Additional EBI training for all staff was conducted on 2/2/22 and 2/9/22. Both children interviewed expressed restraints being done appropriately and having a post-discussion with staff regarding the restraint.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, it was observed that 1/3 restrooms was out of order for 1 week, leaving 21 residents to utilize 2 occupiable restrooms.
Correction Narrative: All toilets were working properly and there were enough bathroom facilities for the children currently placed there.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's self-harming injuries were not documented and staff were not aware of them. Staff did not follow procedure the operations procedure of checking the sleeves when taking medication.
Correction Narrative: CCR inspector received the following information from the LCCA: Effective immediately, the nursing department will meet with each direct care staff member that resides over the med administrating and explain to them the importance of making sure they are following all polices and procedures of the operation during med administering. The nursing department will warrant the importance on checking the sleeves of the residents when the residents are administering  their meds.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was able to obtain a container of medication that was placed within arms reach and subsequently ingested a number of pills from the medication container.
Correction Narrative: CCR Inspector received the following information from the LCCA: Effective immediately the nursing department will  meet with direct care staff that resides over the administrating of the medications. Since the residents administer their own meds, the staff member residing over the med administrating will make sure all of the bottled medications caps are secured on the bottle and the blister packs are all stored away out of reach from the residents.

Deficiency Narrative: During interviewing, it was found that there are some blind spots in video surveillance when supervising children in care. Children also admitted that staff is not always able to see them when they want their actions to be concealed.
Correction Narrative: A physical follow up was conducted on 12/10/21 where supervision was observed. A written response on an updated policy regarding supervision and the surveillance cameras was received on 12/08/21.

Deficiency Narrative: Witness stated that they've overheard staff make statements that she would hit the victim child.
Correction Narrative: A written follow up was received via email on 9/14/21 containing documents where staff were trained concerning proper disciplinary measures. A physical follow up was conducted on 9/29/21 during the operation's routine inspection. Children were interviewed concerning discipline. There were no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care reported a grievance to the operation and it was not reported to licensing until 4 days later.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received entailing the way in which the operation is to come into compliance and correct what has been deemed as deficient. The operation have made the proper corrections to educate staff and administration to ensure it does not occur again. 

The most effective corrective action we made was completing the training titled Recognizing and Reporting Child Sexual Abuse: A Training for Caregivers. This training was required and completed for all care providers (therapists, nurses, direct care, and administration). This new training will be a part of the annual training curriculum moving forward

Deficiency Narrative: Staff were being allowed to execute procedures that do not align with the policies regarding supervision- specifically, room check policy. This lead to child being able to attempt self-harm.
Correction Narrative: A follow up inspection was conducted at the operation to observe the operation's method of supervision following an update to their policies. There were no concerns. Compliance is met.

Deficiency Narrative: The Agency must ensure sufficient staff to address emergency situations where children attempt self-harm and require professional medical attention.
Correction Narrative:
The operation has made adjustments to their policy that include the following as it concerns medical emergencies:
In the event of  a serious illness or injury, 911 is to be called immediately. Non-Medical is to render appropriate first-aid until emergency personnel arrives. Medical decisions are not to be made by any non-medical staff. Non- medical staff may assist with incident reporting. Medical situations where self-harm is attempted & require professional medical attention, will be handled by a licensed medical professional. A physical follow up was conducted on 12/10/21. There were no concerns.
